channel.title: What job for someone who can't read or write?
channel.description:
Ok, before i start, i want to make it perfectly clear that this is a serious topic. so please dont turn this into a stupid thread.
My girlfriend lives about 30 to 45 mins away. This puts a major strain on the relationship because i work 5 days out of the week, saturday being one of them. so can't really go to see her anymore.
I want her to move down to me and to get a place with me.
Problem is, she has a learning disability in the sense that words dont work in her head. She cannot read and write very well. Now i didnt even notice this till she told me a few months after i met her, so she's not stupid, and she can get by with the little reading and writing she does.
but i need to get her a job if she moves down to me. At the moment, she is a dish cleaner at a restaurant. she works 5 mornings a week and pulls in near $250. Because of her 'disability' she qualifies for the pension, which brings up her weekly earning to $250, if she earns less.
What other jobs could someone get that doesnt need you to read, write, use numbers, etc.

item.title: What job for someone who can't read or write?
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

The country isn’t England, so foreign casualties are all good.

Read full topic

item.title: What job for someone who can't read or write?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“pk4pk, post:28, topic:251112”][quote author=Cowie` link=topic=331371.msg2588602#msg2588602 date=1229640764]
Not sure if it’s the same where you live - But my cousin used to be a Taxi Driver, this (Before the rise of fuel costs) would rake him in an average of £300/week.

Maybe she can have a go at that?
[/quote]
Lolololol stop signs
lolololol other signs

On the other hand…

Striper??[/quote]

You don’t have to be able to read to understand stop signs.

And what does a striper do? Draw stripes?

Read full topic

item.title: What job for someone who can't read or write?
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Tree:

I once met a teacher who had dyslexia and he managed fine. It took him a little work but he was still able complete any tasks that he had to.

I’m dyslexic and I can still manage fine. Reading out loud sucks though. Can I get a pension for that?

If she was dyslexic, she would be fine to work most places, so for arguments sake don’t say she is.
Why doesn’t she become a bar tender? A bar wench?

Read full topic
item.source: What job for someone who can't read or write?

not dyslexia… not sure what she has… but for arguments sake… yes, she has dyslexia

item.title: What job for someone who can't read or write?
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Bar work? im doing it atm and getting paid £6.50 an hour… so whats that? about $9 an hour or somethin? Anyhow piss easy work

Oh and im guessing she has dyslexia[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 19, 2008, 04:09:12 am[/size][hr][quote=“skiller noob1, post:19, topic:251112”]Short bus driver? That’s a job anyone can do.[/quote]

Um somehow i dont think that will work

item.title: What job for someone who can't read or write?
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“skiller noob1, post:21, topic:251112”][quote author=Cowie` link=topic=331371.msg2588602#msg2588602 date=1229640764]
Not sure if it’s the same where you live - But my cousin used to be a Taxi Driver, this (Before the rise of fuel costs) would rake him in an average of £300/week.

Maybe she can have a go at that?
[/quote]
My ideas better (No offense) But she’d be with people like her. So maybe she would feel better about herself.[/quote]

Wait, just because she finds reading and writing harder than some people - Doesn’t mean she’s any less capable, she just needs more time to ease into the task at hand. And especially since a Taxi Driver just gets a radio controller telling them where to go, all she has to do is read the number off the meter for the price and the job’s a good 'un.

Read full topic

item.title: What job for someone who can't read or write?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Squigglyo:

Not dyslexia, cant remember what its called. Delayed learning something or other. She can read and write, its just harder for her than normal

Is it something that has to do with the short term memory? A mate of mine had that and he is doing fine.

But are there any clothes shops around your place? Most girls know a thing or two about fashion, and being a clothes seller doesn’t involve that much reading/writing. If her social skills are fine, she’ll do fine. From what I read, she isn’t stupid so keep her away from hamburger flipping or something similar.

Read full topic

item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Restaurants always need dishwashers/table bussers/waitresses/etc…Everywhere.

If she’s not into the whole mindless slave labor thing get her to become a lifeguard/clerk/deskmonkey/mailroomworker/etc… Then she can be a mindful slave laborer.

i dono if this question might go over the limit but… is she hot?[/quote]
Shes got large hips, so if your an ass man, then shes hot

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:12, topic:251112”]Just a question, are you talking about dyslexia which is what she is struggling from?

Anyway, you could try for a janitor job?[/quote]
